  3081. I have called Panasonic and apparently their phones are not working properly
  3082. I have only used it once, it pulls your hair if your not careful.
  3083. Haven't used it for long, but it suits my purposes so far.
  3084. No long cords.
  3085. Unfortunately my old one died but lasted quite a long time and was made sturdy.
  3086. I've not had much success with electric razors in the past
  3087. i wish it had an indicator for full charge instead of the fixed light that indicates 'connected' :( )
  3088. Now I usually don't pay a lot for them but this purchase was worth it.
  3089. and I wish I had bought one the first time before I wasted my money on another company's electric razor.
  3090. at least 4 full leg shaves.
  3091. />The ability to shave dry is life changing - I can shave easily whenever and wherever I want with minimal fuss and mess.
  3092. It's much easier than getting up and down out of the bathtub or balancing on one leg in the shower when agility is diminished by age.
  3093. Not that the shaver is defective or there is anything wrong with it, I just have very fine hair on my legs, which caused it to miss a lot of hair.
  3094. -- It is one small box that has a plug built right into the box.
  3095. So far have just used twice dry...
  3096. Totally surprised at how well it works in the shower with shave gel as well as dry.
  3097. Although this product is value priced delivers a very close shave, it broke in less than 6 months.
  3098. shave is not super close (though I wasn't really expecting it to be).<br
  3099. then I would doing my whole bottom half of one leg with the razor.
  3100. The efficiency saved so much time, and I feel like my shaves are probably half the time
  3101. it's close enough to not see the armpit black pots from a certain distance.
  3102. Unfortunately, I got unlucky--after about 6 months the shaver would barely hold a charge for a few hours (and yes, I generally take good care of my electronics, not leaving them plugged in all the time, and only charging them fully--overnight or for several hours).<br /><br
  3103. I've tried several electric shavers and this particular razor works extremely well.
  3104. But, I've tried all the other brands, and no other comes close to the shave quality and comfort of this shaver for sensitive areas.
  3105. We bought this to replace my Wife's old Shaver (same model - lasted 11 years).Hopefully, this will last as long.
  3106. So far, I have only used it dry
  3107. I treated the shaver gently, stored it in a dry place and cleaned it carefully once a month.
  3108. You really can use it wet or dry.
  3109. It becomes even less useful as a wet razor.
  3110. It really comes down to a personal decision of what works and doesn't work for each individual person.
  3111. Recently I figured out if you make short up and down strokes and go around and around the leg in a spiral, the shave is much closer
  3112. I have not experienced any irritation so far and find that shaving with this is rather quick and pain-free.
  3113. I was unable to get a smooth shave dry, and it was unconfortable to get shave the whole leg.
  3114. It works very well wet or dry and requires only a fee passes to get all underarm
  3115. I still use it on my knees and armpits because the Remington I bought to replace (wet/dry with the aloe vera strip) cuts me pretty badly in those areas but does an OK job on flat parts of my legs.
  3116. Would really like a little closer shave, but all in all it does well.
  3117. I am extremely thorough in my quest for a new product--from cleaning products to shavers.
  3118. The first dry shave was satisfactory although not as close as the shave achieved with my previous electric razor.
  3119. It seemed to go dull VERY quickly - I now have to turn it around backwards and use the other trimming blade to accomplish anything at all.
  3120. It doesn't even give a decently close shave without pressing down, and even then, it's inconsistent and stubbly.
  3121. The charger is small and you just engage the shaver to it so that is also does not take up very much room
  3122. I am not sure whether this malfunction was a very rare exception or not (judging by other reviews, it seems like it may be),but
  3123. I can definitely live with that, and I've had the same problem with every other electric I've used.
  3124. For me, it is well worth paying that little extra for when unknown problems arise.<br
  3125. This razor shaves pretty close leaving very little stubble.
  3126. Not as quick and efficient at cutting as my previous Lady Shave by Phillips but that one lasted so long that I'm sure they don't make the same model anymore.
  3127. my pubic area because my boyfriend is not at all fond of too much &#34;grass&#34; down there!
  3128. (And the recharge is blazing fast - no more leaving my shaver charging overnight to barely get one decent shave before the motor is slowing down.)
  3129. I have very sensitive skin and cannot use a manual razor due to constant razor burns, etc.
  3130. I had gotten a Remmington when I first went to college, but was never very pleased with the results - did not hold a charge long enough, gave me lots of nicks and abrasions, especially at the back of the knee -
  3131. The reviews weren't bad, the product description was good
  3132. Tried few times not shaving clear so back to old way again

All Reviews

  1. I like. It but after a while it. Does not shave any more
  2. Been buying same for yrs good.
  3. Love this! It holds a charge for a long time and gets all the hair.
  4. I received my razor yesterday. The worse razor ever. As I was trying to use it my legged was burning and this razor cut my leg up. I even took pictures of all of my cuts on my leg.
  5. I like this razor a lot, however, the trimmer part just rips the hair out. Ouch!!
  6. Item did not charge properly. I had to return the shaver because I couldn't get it to hold a charge.
  7. So far have just used twice dry...once with trimmer extension and once regular flush to the skin. Was smooth on my skin, no discomfort, good for bikini line for a quick fix but as others have said not quite as smooth as shaving, but very similar to the &#34;one day after shaving&#34; feeling of hair growth with this. The trimmer part I love! Perfect length and consistency, I was afraid it would end up patchy however the tool is very precise and easy to use plus quick. Seems easy to clean and take apart/put back together. Stands easily on charging station when not in use. So far so good!
  8. This is my first time using an electric razor. I wish I would have thought about looking into this option earlier in life. I am 41. I have course, thick, dark black and fast growing hair and have to shave everyday (if showing any leg). With the Panasonic razor I can go every other day or a little bit longer. It is easy to use, charge lasts about a week for me. I do wish the charger light would change colors or turn off so you know when the razor is charged completely. With as expensive as razors have become I started looking at alternatives and this was what I came up with. I am very happy with my purchase. You can shave with soap, body wash, or shaving cream. I have not tried this on dry skin yet. I love that I can take this to my fitness club and do a quick touch up in the shower. Easy to hold. Easy to clean. This is worth the money and a great purchase. 08/21/2015 I am extremely unhappy with this product and Panasonic as a company. My first razor worked great for about 2 months and then stopped holding a charge. I contacted Panasonic at that time, they suggested I send it in to be replaced (at my cost). I did this thinking it was a fluke issue and that the replacement product would be glitch free. It took me about 3 months to get the replacement, after a number of phone calls and e-mails to the service center. The second item worked for a short time so I then again called Panasonic to request a refund of the product, this was on 07/14/2015. I was informed by the representative that I would need to e-mail my receipt to a certain department, which I did. I just got off the phone with customer service and yes I spoke with a supervisor to be informed my 'request for a refund' has been denied and I would need to petition the corporate office via a letter in VA. I am getting ready to start this process. I am very frustrated about the quality of this product and the customer service of Panasonic. All for $41.
  9. Researched quite awhile before purchasing this razor. Easy to use and close shave. Love the compact way it recharges, no cord.
  10. I love it!! It does take about 2-3 weeks for it to be doing its job the best. But now I spend less time in the shower and can shave anytime. Easy to clean and easy to use. I have not used it in the shower yet. Only a dry shave. Love it.
  11. The product arrived in a timely fashion and works well. However, this Panasonic model appears chep and flimsy. I probably would but an upgraded model the next time I was in the market
  12. Got this for my wife at Christmas and she loves it!
  13. Pretty good shaver- it doesn't really shave that closely, when compared to a normal razor. However, it is really convenient. I have mostly used this on trips. The charge seems to last a long time, and it worked best with shaving cream while wet.
  14. I love it. This razor works great - just like I expected. If you are looking for a razor - this is the one.
  15. Did not like this razor at all!
  16. THIS RAZOR IS GREAT FOR USE IN THE SHOWER!!! IT CHARGE'S QUICKLY AND SEEMS TO HOLD CHARGE FOR NEEDED LENGTH OF TIME FOR USING IT!!! IT WILL NEVER REPLACE A PROFESSIONAL BRAZILIAN WAX... BUT FOR MY MONEY ITS ABOUT THE SECOND BEST THING TO A FULL WAX!!!
  17. Product is ok. The closest shave I can get feels like the day after shaving with a razor. I don't know that it is any better than most other e-shavers.
  18. This product does the job. It is easy to use and easy to charge. It's great to take on trips.
  19. This is my second shaver in 20 years. These machines last forever. Leave it plugged in and use it everyday. It doesn't leave your skin as smooth as a razor, only the smallest stubble. I'm married............who cares about shaving :)
  20. if your looking for an easy fast way to get a super ravor like shave not the product for you.
  21. My first Panasonic shaver lasted 10 years. I was so please with it that I just had to replace it with another Panasonic. It is so easy to use because it is cordless, it gives good shaves, and it is easy to clean. I would recommend it to a friend.
  22. Product works just as advertised. Love the bikini attachment too. Perfect for when I need a quick shave. Obviously won't last as long as shaving with a normal razor but it's a lot less hassle which was what i wanted.
  23. This was a good purchase for the price it has worked well I would recommend this to a friend for purchase
  24. Nothing great. I purchased this in the hope that it would be better and easier than a razor, but it's not. I've been using it in the shower but it &#34;skips&#34;, meaning it does not glide smoothly along the legs. Also, it does not do a good job of removing all hairs, especially around the knee area.
  25. I purchased this razor quite some time ago but waited to write a review until I had used it enough times to give it a fair rating. When deciding to purchase an electric razor, you have to remember that you will get a good shave but it will never be as close as using an actual razor. In addition, the coarseness and color of the hair you are shaving will also make a difference in the effectiveness of an electric razor.<br /><br />With that said, I have really enjoyed this electric razor and I mostly use it for times when I don't want to spend the time using a regular razor with shaving cream.. The hair on my legs is fine and light colored so I get a pretty close shave that personally works for me. I could see how if you have dark, coarse hair on your legs, you might not be happy with the results of this razor as the shave would last maybe 1 day before you would see the hair growth again.<br /><br />I know there are mixed reviews on this razor but I think some people will like it while others will prefer another brand. It really comes down to a personal decision of what works and doesn't work for each individual person. If asked, I would recommend this razor for those who are looking for a supplement to traditional razors and do not have dark, course hair.
  26. I use the razor in the shower or while I am taking a bath or while I am watching tv. It is great and stays charge a long time<br /><br />Would purchase again if something happens to it.<br /><br />Love the fact that it can fall in the tub because it is fully immersable
  27. I got this shaver to replace my 10 year old Remington that I really miss. I decided on this shaver based on the positive reviews but I think it's a good shaver for a last minute shave on the rush. I will probably buy another Remington on the near future!
  28. I got this more as a trimmer than a razor. It's nice I can use it in the shower without a problem. I does not give a close shave when used as a razor but the guard for the trimmer is great.
  29. I bought this razor as I am now taking a blood thinner which causes excessive bleeding when you cut yourself. I can use this razor dry ( sitting) on a chair, yeah!) or wet. The shave is not as close as my disposable razor but acceptable! It's much more convenient!
  30. Does exactly what was specified. Legs and underarms are very smooth after using the product. No stubble.
  31. Got this for a Christmas present last year and I have to say that I really like it. It, like all electric razors, doesn't shave as close as a regular razor blade but it does work well for me and gives an acceptable close shave. I have to wear readers to see what I am doing and since I take showers I was always putting off the shaving because I couldn't see well enough. Now I just zap my legs with this razor before I get in the shower and I'm done in a matter of minutes. I have even used this in the bath and it works really well there too. The trimmer works great and so does the adjustable bikini attachment. I no longer have to panic when I wear capris or a dress that I haven't shaved my legs in forever. I just zap those hairs and go!! No water, no soap, no mess.
  32. I bought this for a blind friend with sensitive skin and diabetes and she is very happy with the product and said that is was easy to set up and is performing well. She keeps the razor on the charger that plugs into the wall.<br /><br />One word of caution about the charger, which is a 1.5 inch by 1.5 inch block that plugs into the wall: the blades of the charger plug are vertical blades on the left and right below the socket for the razor device charger plug. If you have wall plugs with horizontal blade holes on the top and bottom, the charger will need an extension of some sort, or one will end up charging razor on it's side (which I imagine is extremely hard to do).<br /><br />The Amazon price was excellent and I appreciated the super saver shipping.<br /><br />[[ASIN:B000G0GW6K Panasonic ES2216PC Close Curves Wet/Dry Ladies Shaver with Bikini Attachment, Mauve]]
  33. i was skeptical when i bought this product, but when i tried it i was amazed at how well it works. not only does it work well but it is very easy to clean. the charger is not bulky at all so it fits easily into luggage. it was worth the buy.
  34. Needed an electric razor to use mostly for underarm area as waxing is getting too expensive! This area is very sensitive on me and this electric razor was just what I was looking for. Using it wet seems to be better for this particular area. But I love being able to use it dry for other areas! The pivot action of the head and the pop up trimmer are fabulous additions that I'd highly recommend.
  35. I was really disappointed with the Panasonic ES2216PC. I've been a long time user of straight razors and I thought I would save money from buying expensive replacement cartridges and save the earth from tossing out blades by buying an electric razor. So I choose this razor hoping to get the same close smooth shave that I got from the straight razor and boy, was I wrong. This razor did not get as close to the skin, even after pushing really hard with the spring loaded head, it still left hair stubble! The head of th razor also pulled on my skin which hurt! The button to turn the razor on and off, seemed flimsy like it would break at any moment. If you accidently pushed the wrong button, the button on the head of the razor, then the cap on the head and the razors inside would go flying across the shower. What a mess! So I returned the razor, and I am back to using my straight razor for a smoother shave.
  36. I love this razor. I read it was noisy and found that when it is you just have to push the head down a little until it clicks and the noise goes away. I use it dry and it works well. It bit me under the arm when I pushed down too hard. Use a light touch. I like the floating head. Easy to clean.
  37. I read all the reviews and finally settled on this razor. I have never had an electric razor so I wasn't sure what to expect but was happy with the results. One reviewer claimed the razor left lines on their legs and I was a bit put off by that, but after using the razor I can only surmise that they were pressing down very hard. The edges of the razor didn't touch my skin at all. I got a nice close shave...closer than I can get with hand razors! I was also a bit concerned about cleaning the razor but it was a breeze to take apart to clean...took seconds! The only negative is the packaging. It took forever for me to get the package open...like breaking into Fort Knox! But, don't let that deter you...it's a great electric razor!

  66. Last week, after shaving with a razor, I decided that I no longer had the ability to do the acrobatic moves required to shave my legs in the tub. I came out looking like a murder victim with blood running down my legs. So I finally broke down and bought this razor in the hopes of easier shaving. I purchased this one because of the lower price combined with well over 300 decent reviews. A product with that many good reviews means it is liked, and is a decent enough design to hold its own against the more expensive electric razors out there. (One reviewer mentioned some other razor, saying everyone would like it better, but the cost was three times of this one with MUCH WORSE reviews, and I could not warrant over a hundred dollars for it.)<br /><br />It showed up yesterday in its nice little box. After reading reviews of how it plugged directly into the wall, I had already purchased a short extension cord for it to plug into, now it can sit on the counter. I followed the instructions about charging it for 12 hours. (All Good equipment with batteries tells you to do that.) Then today is the first time I ever used an electric razor in my 40+ years.<br /><br />The first thing I wish to say to everyone complaining about an electric razor not being as close as a blade. NO ELECTRIC RAZOR WILL CUT AS CLOSE AS A BLADE! But this one is real close, if you work at it a bit. The first time over my legs I used a light touch and it left a bit of stubble. So I went over it again, slowly and experimenting with pressure and direction to see how close of a shave I could get. While it does not feel baby butt smooth it did a real good job. I have only used this dry and I will update once I use it wet.<br /><br />PROS: It comes apart for easy cleaning and future replacement of blades. Can be used wet. Until I started looking for this razor I did not know there was such a thing as a wet use electric razor, YEA! The charger sits nicely on the counter with the extension cord I bought for it, but even if I did not have the cord, the unit snaps securely in the charger and dose not fall out unless you were to knock it onto something. It lightweight and easy to use. I do not understand peoples complaints about the buttons, they have a little locking button to push before sliding it up and the design of the unit would make them very difficult to break them off. The Pivoting head makes it easier to reach those annoying areas (like under the knees.) [When using a blade you have to keep it at a constant angle to not cut yourself.] Comes with a bikini attachment (I have yet to try,) and nice clear plastic cover to protect the heads from dust and other things. It has the \\"GOOD HOUSEKEEPING\\" seal of approval on it. I am NOT spending $15 on my replacement blades every few months which sometimes end up rusty in my shower. I do NOT have to shave in the tub doing acrobatics.<br /><br />Another PRO: I was able to purchase an extended warranty for two years for an additional nine dollars. For me, it is well worth paying that little extra for when unknown problems arise.<br /><br />CONS: UM... It was not FREE! (But then if it were, I doubt it would be as good of a product.) It did not come with any sort of way to keep all the components together when not in use, but that is an easy fix I will go get a little makeup bag to store it in....PROBLEM SOLVED :&lt;) It does seem a bit rough on the skin, but nothing major. It may be a problem if you have super sensitive skin, but I have a skin which is a little sensitive and I did not notice any adverse effects from using it. This also could be from my inexperience of using an electric razor. ITS PINK!!!! Well, more of a pink purple, but still very pink.<br /><br />All-in All, I fully recommend this electric razor to anyone who needs an inexpensive decent razor to use, UNLESS you want want a shave that works like a blade, then I recommend that you save your money and stick with blades. For anyone wanting a CLOSER shave, there are the masochistic epilators, or the one shaver which actually burns and removes the hair (for three easy payments of $$$...AS SEEN ON TV... What ever brand that is), or laser removal. Anyway, it works for my needs, and it is a KEEPER!<br /><br />Good Luck.he masochistic epilators, or the one shaver which actually burns and removes the hair (for three easy payments of $$$...AS SEEN ON TV... What ever brand that is), or laser removal. Anyway, it works for my needs, and it is a KEEPER!<br /><br />Good Luck.

Two things noted: One, the unit does not<br />have a power cord; it has two prongs that need to be slipped directly into a wall socket, or,<br />if desired, plugged into an extension cord. The combined weight of both the shaver and the recharger is such that<br />it takes a very tight fitting wall socket to keep the unit plugged in. Her previous unit had a counter-top recharge<br />unit with a short cord allowing it to be set on the vanity while being plugged into the wall. The second issue, is the fit of the<br />shaver into the recharge unit is such that it requires \\"fiddling\\" to set it in place--especially if the unit is plugged into the wall while trying to reinsert the shaver. In short, Panasonic needs to redesign the charger base.

I've been using my new Panasonic for a few weeks now and have no complaints. It hold its charge for a few shaves and has not nicked me yet!   96. With respect to delivery it was timely and accurate. Description of the product was accurate and works as described. To charge, you snap it into a charger at the bottom, and then plug into the wall. It needs to be vertical, so you need an outlet that is vertical rather than horizontal.<br />I have never used an electric shaver before so was a little tentative, especially about using it in the shower and getting it wet, but I read all the directions and now that I have used it a few times, I've gotten the hang of it and it works great. For legs it shaves as close as a non-electric razor, but harder to do that with underarms. You can rinse it after a few strokes just like a regular razor, but the best way is to remove the top to rinse so that's an extra step - but guessing that's the same with all electrics. It fits comfortably in my hand and is not too heavy. I love that I can use it in the shower. Good choice all around.
  97. I am thoroughly impressed with the Panasonic Wed/Dry shaver. Underarm and bikini shaving is super close without causing razorburn, easy for beach days that I just need a touch-up. Ideally, the reason I purchased this is that the cost of blades for Venus and Gilette shavers has skyrocketed, and even shopping at Costco anymore has become super pricey for replacement blades. When I want a fabulous shave for my legs, I'll still use the Mach 5, but for everyday shaving, I like this product for it's versatility in and out of the shower.<br /><br />One star deduction for the awkward plug/charger along with the battery life. It certainly does not last for 12 days on one charge, so I suppose if that expectation were lowered, I would not have been disappointed. Would purchase again!
  98. This is the first Panasonic electric shaver I have ever owned; and, it's great. It gives me a nice, smooth shave and is comfortable \\"sitting\\" in my hand. I haven't tried using it in the shower; so, can't comment on that; however, compared with previous electric shavers I've owned, it is definitely a big improvement.
  99. Its gives nice clean shave, I have used remington shaver before, but this one is much better. The only problem is replacing the parts for this shaver is expensive.

  106. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!! This is the second time within 6 months that I have bought this product, only to have it fail after the 30-day return window. I am extremely disappointed. When the first shaver, purchased last December, failed to come on--for no evident reason--I called Panasonic customer care. What a waste of time! Their only solution was to package and ship the item to their Texas location, where it would be examined and repaired if possible, or replaced by a new shaver. Besides the time factor--sending it and waiting to get it back would take 10-14 days--it would cost me $27. For a $29 purchase, this clearly was not an option... so I bought another one. Same thing happened with the second one. All I can say is I will never buy a small device like this on-line, because there is no \\"store\\" I can take it to physically.

I had a hard time getting the foils back in straight, and two tiny metal pieces popped out from a crevice behind the foils. I never did get the two pieces to go back in. The foils are no longer evenly spaced, but the shaver works as well as ever, so I guess it's okay. I will be hesitant to take it apart to clean it again, even so.

  120. I have tried Panasonic, Remington, Revlon, and even the hair buffers. I haven't found ANY brand that compares to Panasonic. These shavers last. The first Panasonic I had lasted 6 years, and finally the metal hair cutters broke. I could have just bought a replacement top, but instead bought a new shaver and tried many other brands. All of the other shavers (up to $75) pulled hairs, left hair, couldn't take a charge, or had no power. This is now the 2nd Panasonic I've had and it's just as good as my first. They don't pull hairs, great power, good charge, and the price is always low. I will never buy a different brand, or try another expensive brand. I love these shavers.

  133. My Situation:<br />I have very sensitive skin and I like a close shave. Razor burn is very common when I use a razor blade however I am fortunate to not have many ingrown hairs. Also, when I use a electric razor I usually use it dry so my review will reflect a dry shave.<br />My Story:<br />I came from a remington WDF3500 razor and I liked it but when it was dead one day, I reached for my boyfriends electric razor. WOW! It was such a close shave... Way closer than my remington. It was at that moment I realized that I had to upgrade. I started looking around and after reading the reviews on this razor, I decided to try it. Well I Love it! No razor burn, no irritated skin, and best of all a really close shave. The bikini attachment and the pop up trimmer work great. Clean up is really easy as well. Just a little hand soap directly on the foils, rub it in, and turn the razor on and its clean. Rinse and your done! Clean up takes me about 1 minute. NO EXAGGERATION! The only thing that could have been better (and the main reason I didn't give it 5 stars) is the charging method. It is rechargeable witch is awesome but (and this is kinda hard to explain) the plug is the charger. It is NOT a doc with a cord. Its a cool idea but my setup could have used a doc to charge the razor. All in all this razor is great! If your thinking about upgrading an old razor or looking to start out this is the one for you! Hope it helped

  146. Read over reviews for this and other womens and mens electric razors. This one was in the right price range, had good reviews and didn't have a whole of extra fancy nonsense. I realize that you're not going to get the same kind of shave as a regular razor, but as someone who has extra sensitive skin everywhere, my time of using good old razors is at an end, particularly with summer approaching.<br /><br />Quick shipping, fast charging and wet/dry shave almost as close as a blade? Yup, this thing is great, and no bumps or \\"owies\\". It's easy to clean, and I expect to have it deliver a super sharp shave for at least a year. I got what I expected, and the only reason I didn't give it five stars is that it didn't exceed my expectations, but did meet them satisfactorily.
  147. I got this shaver after trying the [[ASIN:B001IZZX1C Cleancut ES412 Personal Shaver]](also from Amazon). The cleancut did an amazing job of the very intimate brazilian-type shave, but couldn't touch the flat-laying outer hair. Plus, it took loads of battery, and was not large enough to shave anywhere else.<br /><br />This Panasonic fit my needs perfectly. It does not produce a baby-smooth finish, but like many people have said you'll get a result which is like about 12-24 hours after a razor shave. I only need to shave about every 3 days. I use it to maintain a complete Brazilian shave, and it does not pull or pinch, and I have never had a cut. It also does a great job of underarms and legs.<br /><br />I have used it wet with lather and dry. I find I prefer the dry! The wet/lather actually seemed to leave the hairs longer, plus there was water streaming everywhere making it harder to see. Also, hot water makes your skin swell slightly, so after you cool off the hair sticks out farther than at the time of shaving. Dry shaving is a breeze. If I am damp (after a shower, for instance) I followed the advice given for the Cleancut and dust with baby powder. I do not know if this will affect the sharpness of the blades or not. YMMV.<br /><br />About the plug - it is a square base which plugs directly into the socket, and the shaver stands up on it. Exactly like in the picture, with about a 1.5\\" box below it. This works perfectly if you have a modern vanity arrangement in your bathroom, with a plug above the sink. You may find this inconvenient if you only have floor-height plugs to work with, or if you have children who can access those plugs, or if you want to put it behind a dresser, etc. An optional \\"extension cord\\" for those situations would be a great benefit (ATTN: Panasonic!!)<br /><br />Overall, I will continue to use this product, and will most likely not find a need for a blade-razor again!!
  148. This product was great for the first few months. It gave a nice close shave when used dry, and the bikini-attachment worked well for a nice short trim. I was diligent to clean the shaver as directed after each use, and to keep the protective plastic cap on. Still, after several months (no more than 4), the shaver became unbearably painful to use and eventually it became clear that a part was broken (bent wire sticking out and fell off - not good). I looked for a replacement part, but it was just as expensive to replace the part as it was to just buy an entirely new shaver. So I did - I bought the same shaver again, thinking that whatever broke was just a fluke and that the new shaver would be just as wonderful as it had been for the first few months. To much frustration, the new shaver did the same thing! It became painful to use, where it had previously been completely painless. The new one broke even quicker than the first, lasting only 1-2 months.<br /><br />Needless to say, I won't be making the mistake of buying this shaver again, no matter HOW good it was in the beginning. I'd like a shaver that would at least be reliable for a year, preferably more! I would not recommend this product to anyone, unless you don't mind buying a new one every few months.

  158. I bought my wife her first electric razor about 8 years ago. She's gone through three since then. Her favorite used a chemical solution to rinse out the razor, but sadly, it only lasted 1 1/2 years before failing.<br /><br />This razor was a Christmas '10 present, and it's BY FAR her favorite razor ever.<br /><br />She likes that it can be used in the shower, and that it can be cleaned with tap water. The power plug is something I've never seen before. The 'boxy' part plugs in to the wall (like normal), but instead of running a cord to the razor, the razor snaps in to the top of the plug itself. It keeps it out of the way, but still handy. It's a huge space-savings over the other alcohol-rinse system that she had previously.<br /><br />But the best part - she's happy with the way that it shaves. And so am I ;) !!!<br /><br />If it ever dies, I would buy another one. Great product.

  168. I never intended to become a razor tester, but for some inexplicable reason Amazon will not send rechargable razors to Hawaii. At something of a loss (because inventory is slim and dramatically over-priced locally) I bought the [[ASIN:B002HWS4R0 Clio Designs Palmperfect Electric Shaver in Patterns, 1 Shaver]] which is hands-down the worst electric razor I have ever used, more of a toy than a \\"personal care\\" item. Up to this point I have had exceptional experience with Panasonic products, and have, in other reviews, lauded their cameras and Men's razor, pointing to this item as a better option than the Clio based on the reviews on this site (and having owned an earlier model in this line). Now that I own one (which I had to procure elseplace :( ) my opinion is much revised. While this is clearly better than the Clio (that is not saying much. It's the easy-bake oven of razors) it does not hold a candle to either the [[ASIN:B0015MKZZ2 2in1 Smooth&Silky Women's shav]] or the panasonic men's [[ASIN:B005DKKBP6 Panasonic ES-LV81-K Arc 5 Multi Flex Wet/Dry Nanotech Rechargeable Shaver with Vortex Cleaning System, Black]] Granted there is a large price difference (between the Men's exceptional razor and the women's mediocre one) but this razor didn't perform an awful lot better than the toy. It still took me 2 passes to get a reasonably clean shave, and was not especially smooth or comfortable. To me comfort and safety are very important, as is getting a close shave (it is relatively simple and cheap to get one without the other). In this respect, the Pansonic fell down on the job.<br /><br />I also did not care for the set-up. It has a small footprint, making it better for travel than most, BUT I use it primarily at home (and would think that most other people do as well). instead of something like a dock, which most rechargeable razors (both men's and women's) have, this razor snaps on to a tiny plug which hangs awkwardly, precipitously off the wall. It did stay in place, but it blocks use of the other plug and is somewhat awkward.<br /><br />I would *maybe* recommend this as a travel razor. It is better than the Clio, but still bulkier than a disposable blade razor, and not as close. It is, however, safer than a blade, so if you are willing to carry a certain amount of weight and bulk, this might be the answer. (but, honestly it is not much smaller or lighter than other electric razors).<br /><br />Up to this point I have been very happy with all the Panasonic products I purchased. This one is enough of a disappointment that I am about to purchase my third electric razor in less than a month :( and this time I will stick with the one I know: Remington!<br /><br />On second thought, I realized that I have been a bit harsh (on the brand). This particular razor was a disappointment, but I had another from this line a year or two ago and was happy with it (else I would not have pointed to it in another razor review). I can not comment on the others in the line at the moment as they are out of reach to me (Amazon won't mail them here; local stores don't carry them and I have not found anyone else mailing these to Hawaii). It is possible, probably even that they have maintained the quality but not being able to get my hands on one it would not be fair of me to comment either way. I will just note that this particular razor is the low end of the line and the others are likely better. I just could not get one.e, but it blocks use of the other plug and is somewhat awkward. I would *maybe* recommend this as a travel razor. It is better than the Clio, but still bulkier than a disposable blade razor, and not as close. It is, however, safer than a blade, so if you are willing to carry a certain amount of weight and bulk, this might be the answer. (but, honestly it is not much smaller or lighter than other electric razors). Up to this point I have been very happy with all the Panasonic products I purchased. This one is enough of a disappointment that I am about to purchase my third electric razor in less than a month :( and this time I will stick with the one I know: Remington! On second thought, I realized that I have been a bit harsh (on the brand). This particular razor was a disappointment, but I had another from this line a year or two ago and was happy with it (else I would not have pointed to it in another razor review). I can not comment on the others in the line at the moment as they are out of reach to me (Amazon won't mail them here; local stores don't carry them and I have not found anyone else mailing these to Hawaii). It is possible, probably even that they have maintained the quality but not being able to get my hands on one it would not be fair of me to comment either way. I will just note that this particular razor is the low end of the line and the others are likely better. I just could not get one.

  175. Overall, great shaver for the price but one drawback. PROS: smooth, comfortable shave. Long lasting battery charge. Love the pop-up trimmer. No nicks, cuts or burns. Pivoting head is fantastic for bikini area and lower--can get all the nooks and crannies. Ergonomic handle easy to grip in shower. ONE BIG CON: not durable! One drop in the shower and it's toast. I haven't had one of these last longer than 6 months. But, I've tried all the other brands, and no other comes close to the shave quality and comfort of this shaver for sensitive areas. So for around $30 a pop I have to replace it 2-3 times per year--but many other shavers are $90+ each, so I suppose that expense isn't bad. Just inconvenient to have to go without shaving a couple days until I buy my next replacement.
  176. This was the second shaver I tried (first one was not Panasonic) so was not optimistic. Totally surprised at how well it works in the shower with shave gel as well as dry. Close shave and so much faster for daily touch ups. I also like that it plugs directly into outlet so doesn't take up space on the vanity.
  177. it did not contain a manual other wis it is fine.
  178. i bought the wahl shaver, mainly because of the brand name. If you get a \\"wahl\\", you can't go wrong. Right? Well, it wasn't a bad investment, but compared to this Panasonic? i wondered, wow, where was this shaver when i needed it the most.<br /><br />the Beret leaves light skin scratches behind and at least 1/8\\" stubble behind when shaving the legs.<br /><br />The Panasonic left absolutely nothing. A close smooth shave, looked like a good wax job.<br /><br />The Beret looses it charge quickly, and over time, it worsens. When shaving in the private areas, where the hair is coarser? It left behind raised stubble, and when the charge weakens, it snagged. To the point that i finally threw it away.<br /><br />the Panasonic? I thought i had a bikini wax. It is a larger head piece, but because it pivots, you can make the curves. Plus, because the hair grows in different directions/patterns, you have to work the shaver in the direction the hair grows. Once i figured this out, my shave was fantastic.<br /><br />i am very pleased not only with this purchase, but with the customer service of the seller as well!
  179. it dosent work at all...a total rip off

  182. I have coarse, dark hair that grows quickly and fair skin, so I normally shave with a razor every other day. I have never tried an electric shaver before. I have only used the Panasonic shaver dry at this point. It was easy to use and gave my legs the appearance of being shaven, but my legs still felt rough and stubbly. It's something I would use if I didn't have time to shave with a razor before going to the gym, but not if I really wanted my legs to feel smooth. I tried the bikini attachment,and all it did was catch and pull the hair. It did not cut it at all. I would recommend this for people that don't have coarse hair or for occasional use when appearance is all that matters.
  183. I highly recommend this ladies shaver. I thought nothing would be good as a regular razor on my legs, but this one works just as well.   196. Although this product is value priced delivers a very close shave, it broke in less than 6 months. I only used it about twice weekly. The trimmer wouldn't slide out anymore, and was loosely held in a partially extended position. I was able to continue use for a short time like that, but then it started tearing my skin. Also, the charge held nicely when I first got it, but after a few months didn't perform as well.<br />This was actually my second try at this product -- the foil on the first one broke. I assume the break occurred while I was cleaning it or reattaching the head, although I am surprised since I feel like I handled the product reasonably. Since I did like the close shave, I decided to order another and handle it extra gently.<br />Since it was the trimmer that broke on the second, it was certainly not my fault.<br />Both shavers wound up in the trash too quickly. Not worth it.<br />I would not recommend this product.
  197. I bought this shaver a while ago, and I hardly use it. I bought it to use on my legs and bikini area.   199. This is my first ever wet/dry shaver so I don't know if using one dry usually results in a faint stubble left behind, but that's what I get. Results improved with wet shave and shampoo.   200. If you order this item, opt for the higher priced model, I wish I had. The shaver is more than adequate for the legs but not for underarm or other parts of the body. However I do like how easy it is to recharge with no hanging cords.   204. This shaver is the most comfortable razor I have ever used. I've been using it for several months now and have never cut myself of gotten razor burn. On the downside the shave isn't the closest, but it is close enough if you shave often.<br /><br />It seems to shave better dry than wet<br /><br />The battery life is good. It says it lasts for 7 shaves, but it really only lasts for 2 or 3 if you shave your entire legs twice, but this is longer than others I have used.<br /><br />I agree with other reviews that the design of the charger is absolutely terrible, but the razor itself is great.
  205. I just LOVE this shaver! This is a great item to quickly take care of bikini areas or legs before heading to the beach. I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for something to use occasionally. I'm not sure how the bikini attachment thing is suppose to work. It doesn't seem to do anything. This razor is gentle enough you won't need that attachment for the bikini area at all. It holds a charge great and is quick and easy to recharge. All in all, buy it - you'll like it!

  207. I do like this shaver, however, I still feel a razor shaves closer.   225. I'm a male, and I'm a cyclist. As such, I shave my legs. After finishing a $40 pack of disposable razor blades, I tried my girlfriends Remington. She used both on me, and said keep the Panasonic.<br /><br />As others have mentioned the charger is not very well designed. If you have old/really used outlets (like in a bathroom), it will have trouble staying in the wall. An extension cord works fine.<br /><br />- 1 star for charger design.
  226. The charge doesn't last for more than 15 minutes. It does a decent job at shaving but takes forever to charge.
  227. I've had a couple electric razors over the years and this is by far the worst. You have to go over every section multiple times because it keeps missing hair. The whole point of an electric razor for me is to save time, so this is going to have to go!
  228. Worth the cost.<br /><br />When shaving longer hair, it will take a while.<br /><br />Go slower in sensitive areas. Hair is less likely to get caught and painfully yanked.<br /><br />Some people say their shave was not smooth, I didn't have that issue. It may differ from person to person or perhaps it's the way you shave. I hold my skin back and shave against the grain for a close smooth shave.
  229. Why did no one tell me about electric shaving before?<br /><br />Whomever came up with the idea that women need to shave half their bodies to go outside was probably a) a razor advertiser, and b) a man. Contorting oneself in the shower with a sharp implement rubbed all over your body is not a pleasant experience and with my sensitive skin and thick hair I found it to be very time consuming and perilous.<br /><br />I had never tried electric shaving, but this Panasonic shaver is inexpensive and has some good reviews.<br /><br />The shave is great - my hair grows so fast that within hours after a normal shave I have some hair growing anyways. So it doesn't matter to me too much that this shave isn't 100% as close as a normal shave. It's close enough to feel fairly smooth and look completely presentable - and I have thick dark hair and very pale skin.<br /><br />Also it doesn't irritate my skin at all. People complain in some reviews about the plastic guards above and below the foils. They do stick out, but I don't think they're sharp and they didn't bother me at all. Compare some plastic rubbing on your skin with a sharp metal blade and I think you'll find the plastic is far more pleasant.<br /><br />The ability to shave dry is life changing - I can shave easily whenever and wherever I want with minimal fuss and mess. Wet shaving armpits when you're already dressed is really inconvenient - this solves that problem. I also like that I can shave wet if I need to.<br /><br />My review may not be helpful to you if you already have electric razor experience and want a comparison to other razors - but if you're a first time electric razor buyer, I strongly recommend this razor to you.<br /><br />I thought about going with a men's razor - it seems like there ought to be something snazzy you get for 10x the price (literally, many men's razors do cost 10x what this one costs). However, I couldn't find enough compelling evidence to spend 10x as much, or even 3x as much - this ladies razor really does the trick. And if it does wear out in a year, I can afford to buy a new one. Although I'd rather not since that would be environmentally unfriendly.<br /><br />I do experience some very mild razor burn or irritation in my armpits after shaving with this - I can only tell because I apply witch hazel afterwards and it burns. It's far less than with shaving though and doesn't bother me, but if you're looking for completely burn free shaving the super high end men's razors might offer that experience.<br />__________<br /><br />Update:<br />This shaver is all I wrote before, *when fully charged*. If the battery is getting low, it starts yanking on your hairs, taking forever to get anything done, and just overall not working. I would like to see Panasonic come out with a new model of this product with better battery technology. The product literally does not function as it should without a close to full charge, which should not be the case.<br /><br />There should also be a battery meter so you know when to recharge instead of having it die while you're trying to shave and rush out the door. I am tempted to buy a second one, so I can have one charging and one to use.<br /><br />_________________<br /><br />Update:<br />I finally upgraded to a men's 15000rpm Panasonic shaver. The difference between that and this women's shaver is a Mercedes Benz versus a garbage truck. They will both get you there, but one is going to be a lot quieter, faster, and more comfortable. Given that women shave more of their bodies than men it surprises me that there aren't better shaving options for women. I recommend getting a men's shaver if you want the full experience. I paid about 4-5x the cost of this shaver, but it is well worth it. The women's shaver had stopped working very well since it couldn't get fully charged long enough to do both legs, frequently leaving me with only one leg shaved. My new men's shaver has a longer lasting battery with a battery meter and is &#34;Made in Japan&#34; versus &#34;Made in China&#34; for the women's shaver. The head is larger and pivots more. It is an ugly black color, but other than that it is better on every level than this women's shaver which now feels like a poorly functioning toy in comparison.<br /><br />Update: I didn't want to recommend any particular men's model, just that you buy a men's electric razor instead, but due to popular demand, here is the model of men's shaver I purchased: [[ASIN:B002N5MHLK Panasonic ES-LA93-K, Arc4 Electric Razor, Men's 4-Blade with Multi-Flex Pivoting Head and Dual Motor, Premium Automatic Clean & Charge Station Included, Wet or Dry Operation]] and my review of it: http://smile.amazon.com/review/R1BB4BSB822648/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm<br />This was the highest end model available at the time and has been working very well for over 5 years. But any men's model should be fine, they appear to all be engineered to a higher standard than the women's model - it's not necessary to buy the top of the line, and I found the charging station superfluous after a year or so.<br />____________________________________<br /><br />Further update:<br />Another life changing upgrade!<br />The men's razor was still great, but shaving was taking too long, especially for longer hairs and large areas. So after a lot of research and a long hesitation to spend more again on shaving equipment, I purchased an Oster cordless hair trimmer (for dogs) and an Andis Outliner blade [[ASIN:B000MC7SQA Andis Outliner Beard Trimmer UltraEdge Detachable Blade, Silver, Size 1/150 (64160)]] to trim longer hairs and shave legs. By reading reviews, I found out a lot of men use a hair trimmer on their face, as it is much gentler, and also works much better on longer hairs, but no one ever mentioned this for women! It is at least 10x faster to shave and does not damage my (thin, pale, sensitive) skin. I also found out hair trimmers are used for surgery prep instead of razors to prevent small cuts in the skin. It does leave a tiny bit of very short stubble, but I can leave the house with the result.<br /><br />The trimmer works especially well before the electric shaver for a smooth result quickly without skin irritation. I only wish I had found this sooner - I almost enjoy shaving now, and it can be done quickly, dry, anytime, with no injury. Ignore any labels that say they are to trim dog's hair, sheep, horses, men's head hair, etc. Hair is hair and trimming is trimming. As a bonus you could also trim your dog, sheep, horses, and male relatives hair (with a different blade).ith a battery meter and is &#34;Made in Japan&#34; versus &#34;Made in China&#34; for the women's shaver. The head is larger and pivots more. It is an ugly black color, but other than that it is better on every level than this women's shaver which now feels like a poorly functioning toy in comparison.<br /><br />Update: I didn't want to recommend any particular men's model, just that you buy a men's electric razor instead, but due to popular demand, here is the model of men's shaver I purchased: [[ASIN:B002N5MHLK Panasonic ES-LA93-K, Arc4 Electric Razor, Men's 4-Blade with Multi-Flex Pivoting Head and Dual Motor, Premium Automatic Clean & Charge Station Included, Wet or Dry Operation]] and my review of it: http://smile.amazon.com/review/R1BB4BSB822648/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm<br />This was the highest end model available at the time and has been working very well for over 5 years. But any men's model should be fine, they appear to all be engineered to a higher standard than the women's model - it's not necessary to buy the top of the line, and I found the charging station superfluous after a year or so.<br />____________________________________<br /><br />Further update:<br />Another life changing upgrade!<br />The men's razor was still great, but shaving was taking too long, especially for longer hairs and large areas. So after a lot of research and a long hesitation to spend more again on shaving equipment, I purchased an Oster cordless hair trimmer (for dogs) and an Andis Outliner blade [[ASIN:B000MC7SQA Andis Outliner Beard Trimmer UltraEdge Detachable Blade, Silver, Size 1/150 (64160)]] to trim longer hairs and shave legs. By reading reviews, I found out a lot of men use a hair trimmer on their face, as it is much gentler, and also works much better on longer hairs, but no one ever mentioned this for women! It is at least 10x faster to shave and does not damage my (thin, pale, sensitive) skin. I also found out hair trimmers are used for surgery prep instead ofrazors to prevent small cuts in the skin. It does leave a tiny bit of very short stubble, but I can leave the house with the result.<br /><br />The trimmer works especially well before the electric shaver for a smooth result quickly without skin irritation. I only wish I had found this sooner - I almost enjoy shaving now, and it can be done quickly, dry, anytime, with no injury. Ignore any labels that say they are to trim dog's hair, sheep, horses, men's head hair, etc. Hair is hair and trimming is trimming. As a bonus you could also trim your dog, sheep, horses, and male relatives hair (with a different blade).

  254. I had a Panasonic before (similar shape but a different type) and another Barun earlier. I have fine hair (still hairy) and very sensitive skins.   276. I've owned two of these and since the second one did what the first one did, I have to say they're complete garbage. Almost to the point of being a scam.<br /><br />After 4 to 6 months - when you take it off the charger and turn it on, there's a few seconds pause before the motor kicks in. Over the next month or two after that, that pause becomes longer and longer until the unit simply won't turn on anymore.<br /><br />It's not the battery - the device works fine and has a strong charge once it turns on. And I never submerged it in water. It seems like a defect in the on/off switch.<br /><br />If you feel like you wouldn't mind having to buy one of these every 5 or 6 months then buy it: it does the job well while it works.<br /><br />I simply believe they should last a couple years. It's obvious that Panasonic blew it with this razor.

  279. Ladies...I have tried almost every method to shave my legs. I have pretty thick, course leg hair. Must be my German heritage! I've use razors (wastes water in shower), wax(messy) , neat(stinky and left behind strays), epi-ladies(which work but take forever to get the job done. I call it my midevil torture device, as it is painful the first couple of times you use it. My recommendation for this one is valium! And you don't stay hair free for eight weeks like it says. THOSE hairs you just ripped out will take that long to grow back but there is always new hair coming in, so a once a week session is still in order). My first electric was a Remington. That one lasted a couple of weeks as I didn't appreciate the fact that it sounded like a buzz saw and you could hear it running from 2 counties away. And it took too many passes. I then tried this Panasonic ES2216. It was definitely a little quieter, but still louder than my hubby's Norelco. It worked fairly well at first, but before a year was even up, it stopped cutting my hairs. I would go out in daylight and be horrified at the amount of hair it missed. I replaced the blades and it still wouldn't cut my hair. So while my hubby was away (SHHH!) I pulled out his Norelco triple headed Speed XL that was at least 2 years old and had rarely been cleaned or had a blade replacement and it was like OMG! Fast, QUIET, and did the job. So here is what I recommend. Ditch those ladies specific shavers if you want a clean, close, quiet shave and go out and get yourself a manly shaver for those womanly legs. You'll be glad you did. I just got the Norelco 8250 Speed XL and it was sweet! Women's razors just don't cut it.
  280. UPDATE: My shaver died after using it a few times per week for 6 months. I mailed it to Panasonic and received a replacement, the ES207P: http://www.amazon.com/Panasonic-ES2207P-Curves-rechargeable-Ladies/dp/B0018A32XS/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1343180022&sr=8-1&keywords=Panasonic+ES2207P I don't care for the new shaver as much as I did this model. We'll see how long the new model lasts...<br /><br />***<br /><br />I purchased this shaver to groom my nether region (\\"bikini\\" seems like a bit of a misnomer, doesn't it?). I was looking for a device that would give a close shave without cutting my skin, and also do a good job at being precise so that I could leave some hair. Unfortunately, while I suspect this shaver is good for large areas like legs, it is just adequate for your ladyparts.<br /><br />Pros: I like how the shaver head pivots. That gives you a nice smooth movement with the shaver for the varied terrain of your valley. I also like that it is lightweight and can be used in the shower. It is easy to clean and hold.<br /><br />Cons: You cannot get a straight line with this thing. It comes with a pop-out apparatus for this purpose, but it consistently pulls your hair and is essentially useless. The \\"bikini attachment,\\" which is a guard so you can leave a little length on some hair, is not useful to me because it is spaced from the blade such that the hair you would be leaving would be quite long for my taste. The \\"mauve\\" color is ugly.<br /><br />Overall, I am okay with this shaver, but it could be better. If you are mowing the entire field, it should be good for that purpose, but if you want to hedge with ease, look elsewhere. I recommend the extremely cheap but useful Clio, which can be purchased at Walgreens. It will cut you from time to time, but it's strong where this device fails (still pink, though).

  289. Although my wife was very happy with the results when shaving, this product has a design flaw. My wife is now on her second razor of this model and it has stopped working. The first was ordered Feb 14 2013 and the second Nov 14 2014. Both are still in warranty which right now is worthless as you will see later in this review. I am very knowledgeable about what makes things run and why they do not. When the razor is put into the charger one of the pins is pushed into the razor slightly to open a switch that prevents the razor from running while charging. This is a wonderful safety idea that prevents the charger from over heating. Only problem is that the switch design is very poor. When I opened the first razor and examined the switch I found that although it appeared to be closed it was not making an electrical connection. It was dirty, possibly from melted sealant or lubricant used. In either case simply touching the metal contacts allowed the razor head, which was still attached and in my hand to run. Actuating the switch by pushing and releasing the pin in the base of the battery housing caused the razor head to stop and it would not run until I pushed slightly on the contacts again. After reading other reviews where intermittent operation was mentioned or where premature battery failure occurred I can only conclude it was caused by this switch. I have called Panasonic and apparently their phones are not working properly and they can't hear me after I have been switched to several departments. Although you must enter your phone number before you can be connected to anyone I never receive a call from them to find out why they can't hear me. My wife now has 2 dead razors and I must take them apart to remove 2 good batteries for proper disposal.
  290. It works well which is more than I can say for the one I replaced! It's light weight. go for it!
  291. Works pretty well in lieu of shaving with a \\"real\\" razor. It's much easier than getting up and down out of the bathtub or balancing on one leg in the shower when agility is diminished by age. Suits my purpose fine.

  306. I was really excited to get this item when I purchased it because I hate shaving. It very annoying to do especially with a razor, cream, and that risk of cutting yourself. I was ready to toss the razors...but that didn't happen. Anyway here's my review from personal experience. I will rate each thing I tried with this razor 1-5, 5 rating good and 1 rating poor. Here goes...<br /><br />For underarms:<br />Rating 1<br />Ok so for the underarms, it doesn't really work that well because the hairs underarms are really thick. It cuts it. Now when I say it cuts it, it doesn't really go in there to do its job. It kinda trims off the tops of the hair and you're still left with underarm stubble that grows back twice as fast as using a regular razor because you didn't go as low. I wouldn't suggest using this underarms because it just didn't work well for that area.<br /><br />For legs:<br />Rating 2.5<br />The razor works much better on the leg area. But again, its still the same. It doesn't really cut as close or as well as I would have liked. The product says you can use it wet but it doesn't cut anything at all when you use it wet and it takes twice as long so I suggest using it when you're dry. After using it, my legs felt stubbly and unattractive. I had to go back to regular razor shaving. With this razor, it doesn't get all the hairs in one pass so you have to continuously make passes back over those areas.<br /><br />For bikini area:<br />Rating 4<br />The product feels like it was made much more for the bikini area. It included a hair guard attachment and there's a piece that you can push up, the part of the blade, when you're ready to start. The product works much better as a hair trimmer than an actual razor. I even tried this product on my bikini area wet and even tried to trim the area wet with the guard and it just didn't work as well as dry use.<br /><br />Overall, OK as a trimmer for the bikini area but not a full on replacement razor. It includes a neat wall charger that allows the shaver to stand upright (rechargeable) and hair guard (bikini attachment). If you're looking for a razor that really cuts close, this isn't the one. I'm just glad I only paid $26 bucks for it.hair guard (bikini attachment). If you're looking for a razor that really cuts close, this isn't the one. I'm just glad I only paid $26 bucks for it.

  346. When I broke the foil on my Remington (which I LOVED) it was almost the same price to replace it as to buy a new razor. So I searched long and hard and saw that this Panasonic model got rave reviews everywhere. I decided to get it based on the reviews - I sure wish I hadn't now! Not sure if other folks haven't used good razors so they have nothing to compare to or if I got a dud but this razor has been terrible since day 1 (I've had it for about a year now). And I don't have particularly course or thick hair either - I'd consider it average...<br />* It randomly snags & pulls your hair instead of cutting it all the time. (ouch!)<br />* It runs out of juice FAST! Sometimes I can't finish both legs before needing a recharge when it had been charging for days.<br />* You have to go over the same spot many times to get all of the hairs.<br />* It doesn't give a close shave - my Remington was almost as smooth as with a non-electric razor!<br />* It seemed to go dull VERY quickly - I now have to turn it around backwards and use the other trimming blade to accomplish anything at all. The foil section does absolutely nothing.<br />Bottom line, this razor was awful from the first time I used it on - I should have returned it but just didn't take the time to. I loved my Remington and I'm going to trash this and get one of those instead. What a waste of plastic & resources :(<br />p.s.   347. My fiance keeps his head shaved and thus, he has several electronic razors. He likes all that he has and his shopping process has been pretty straight forward. Trying to find a decent razor designed for a woman is time consuming and tedious at best. After much looking and review reading I settled on this Panasonic. Oh my god. What a P.O.S. - I think if my goal had been to find the worst razor out there that I would have chosen this monstrosity of torture. It pulls hair, skips right over massive patches of hair and in general is a pain in the ass. It performs no where remotely like it claims to. The best thing about this razor is that it's a pretty pink color. I ended up ordering a Philips Norelco Qt4070 Turbo Vacuum Beard, Stubble and Moustach Trimmer Pro, Black/silver, made for men. It works like a dream. I would absolutely never recommend the Panasonic to anyone.
  348. This is the first electric shaver that I've ever used. While I like the look and feel of the product, it is useless to give a close shave.   349. This is the first electric shaver that I've had, so I can't compare it to anything else, but I'm not incredibly impressed. For one thing, if I don't shave every day, it doesn't work well- it doesn't get all of the hair. And forget it if I wait a week or two- if your hair is long at all, it won't even work. Perhaps this is the nature of the beast, but I don't like it. Also, after a few months, I've found that the motor seems to be weakening considerably, even when it's fully charged- of course these things will die eventually, but this one seems to have an especially short life.
  350. I HATE stubble in between showers and this is exactly what I was looking for! It does NOT give as close a shave as a razor-but I didn't expect it to. It also takes several swipes instead of just one-but it's worth it! One tip-I've found my legs are dry after using it, and apply lotion-voila!

  357. I got this for myself just the other day after deciding to revisit my hair strategy ([...]). After reading all the reviews, both positive and negative, I decided to give this shaver a try.<br />Here are the results:<br />1. It definitely isn't as close a shave as a razor. This isn't a date-night solution to shaving (unless you're dating someone who's into cactus). It's serviceable enough for day-to-day shaving as long as no one is getting down and inspecting your legs. I have dark and copious hair, so my legs really show dark hair. I don't feel comfortable using this as my shaving solution around anything other than tights.<br />2. The best way to get the closest possible shave is (as another reviewer noted) pulling your skin taut and wet shaving.<br />3. The real breakthrough was the bikini trimmer... I've always thought that my options were razor or waxing, neither of which is comfortable AT ALL. This is an absolute REVELATION in shaving. There are multiple lengths and shearing was very easy.<br />4. It kind of hurt to use on my under-arms, but I have sensitive under-arms. I imagine with some time, I could get better at shaving painlessly.<br /><br />I don't have points of comparison for other shavers, so I can't tell you how this one rates in relation to all the other shavers in the world. The charge held for my entire session, so no complaints there. The shaver itself seems well made and the little attachment brush helps rid the shaver of longer hairs.<br /><br />I can tell you, though, that now that I have used this shaver, I will use a shaver forever more. I'm definitely converted!
  358. This electric shaver is so not quiet. It makes a loud noise. You should charge it after every use. It does an okay job. It could have been a little cheaper.

  360. My Panasonic shaver is less than a year old. I bought this shaver to use one to two times per week to shave my underarms and bikini line, so the shaver has not received heavy use that would explain the problems I am currently experiencing. For the first few months, the shaver worked perfectly. However, the pop-up trimmer, which I only used once every one to two weeks, is now useless as it yanks hairs out rather than trims them. The regular shaving head also yanks hairs now and then. Now it takes more than a few passes of the shaver on my skin to completely remove hair. I would never expect a pricey Panasonic shaver that is less than a year old with only one to two times per week of usage on a small area of my body to perform poorly at shaving hair at this point in time. I clean this shaver after each use according to the directions in the instruction booklet and use the shaver on a full charge, so the performance issues are not due to a dirty shaver or a weak charge.
  361. I went with this model based on other reviews...and because of the \\"pivoting\\" head.<br /><br />What I've liked about it: The trimmers work really well on longer hair -hey, gimme a break, being on hospital bedrest with a timed limit on your daily showers makes it super hard to shave regularly! The blades themselves also manage to get quite close to the skin. I've had no skin irritation with this shaver, while with others I've definitely felt the tug and pull, which has then caused weird razor-ish-burn. It's fairly quiet, and it holds a charge really well.<br /><br />What I don't like about it: I've had other electric shavers that give a closer shave. This one doesn't ever get my legs really smooth, but it does the required job.   382. When I first got this shaver a couple years ago, I hadn't had an electric shaver before. I had nothing to compare it to. I thought, &#34;Not bad, much better than shaving my thighs with a disposable.&#34; Well, it broke about six months ago (a metal piece popped out). I didn't bother getting a replacement until a couple weeks ago, and I'm glad I didn't replace it with the same shaver. I got the Braun Silk Epil: twice the price but a million times worth it. This Panasonic Close Curves is bulky and plasticky. The pop-up razor really doesn't work efficiently. In fact, that's the problem with the entire shaver--it's inefficient. The double foil doesn't allow for curves; it just cannot be used on underarms and is difficult around knees and ankles. I was okay with the lame shave on my thighs just because it's a huge pain to use the disposable there, and it's finer hair than my calves, so a not-so-close shave was okay. I give props for the idea of the adjustable bikini trimmer attachment--I just wish it worked and trimmed the hair. I was using scissors instead until I got my new shaver, which has a great bikini trimmer attachment, though not adjustable. This really isn't a *terrible* shaver (it does cut your hair!), but once you use a *great* shaver, you realize just how incredibly SUB-PAR this one is.
  383. As a shaver, I suppose this is as good as you can get with an electric. I still prefer the old fashioned razor blade and shaving gel method for the closest shave. So, as a close shaver, it's alright, but use extreme caution if you're going to use it as a trimmer. It might be alright for others, as I have extremely sensitive skin... but I definitely won't be using it that way again.

  453. I purchased this shaver as an upgrade to the ES2207P (http://www.amazon.com/Panasonic-ES2207P-Curves-rechargeable-Ladies/dp/B0018A32XS/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1344406659&sr=8-2&keywords=panasonic+ladies+shaver) that I had for a few months. It worked well, but after a few months it started to stop working as well as it did and I decided not to give up on Panasonic but rather to try the next model up.<br /><br />Boy, was I glad I did! Don't be fooled, previous ES2207P owners, the ES2216PC is not just an improvement design-wise! (while I do love the revamped design and the stylish mauve charging dock). I was a little skeptic that this shaver was going to be THAT much better than the previous one, as it was just 10 dollars more. However, that first shave proved me wrong! It gave an amazingly close shave (comparative to the ES2207P), and caught ALL of the hairs in a line the first time. The efficiency saved so much time, and I feel like my shaves are probably half the time now.<br /><br />I will warn you, they're not lying when they say \\"the sharpest blades.\\" I was a little taken aback at first since I could actually FEEL the shave this time, rather than the ES2207P which would just drag over my skin. It would tingle a little, and was the tiniest bit painful in my more delicate zones. However, that is just the blades getting deeper and grabbing more of the hairs, and I would never trade that up. If you're getting hurt, you're probably pushing way too hard because the machine is designed to be painless.<br /><br />I must also address the noise concern: yes, this shaver is noisy, much louder than the ES2207P, so don't plan on using it in the library! However, I get used to the sound very quickly, and since the shave is shorter, it doesn't have to be on for very long.<br /><br />I have not yet used this shaver wet because it is just so much more convenient to use dry. My skin feels silky smooth, like when I used to use razors, and I am so grateful for this product!<br /><br />Just in case you were too lazy to read or wanted a quick wrap-up:<br /><br />PROS:<br />- Excellent, close shave (for an electric)<br />- Easy to clean with simple instructions<br />- No nicks or cuts<br />- Long-lasting battery life<br />- Attachable bikini trimmer with 3 settings plus head cover and cleaning brush<br /><br />CONS:<br />- Noisy/>Just in case you were too lazy to read or wanted a quick wrap-up:<br /><br />PROS:<br />- Excellent, close shave (for an electric)<br />- Easy to clean with simple instructions<br />- No nicks or cuts<br />- Long-lasting battery life<br />- Attachable bikini trimmer with 3 settings plus head cover and cleaning brush<br /><br />CONS:<br />- Noisy

I like a nice close shave and figured I'd have to give that up by switching to an electric razor.   482. The charger for this product plugs directly into the wall plug in/outlet. The charger is a little cube that allows for the shaver to sit right on top of the cube when it is plugged into the wall plug in. If the wall plug in has a north south orientation for receiving the plug, the charger will not work properly. The shaver when plugged in for charging needs to be vertical, the north/south orientation only allows for a horizontal position. I had to spend 7more $s to correct the orientation.<br /><br />Panasonic should have allowed to this problem and included a fix! If I knew this prior to purchase I would not have bought. We will see how my fix works? If not satisfied the shaver will be returned!!

  493. I bought this shaver 2 or 3 times over the years after having a hard time choosing a women's shaver that seemed to work well at a reasonable price. Each time, the ES2216PC would work ok for a few months, but before long the battery wouldn't hold a charge for more than 1 or 2 shaves, and in general just seemed to underperform, not leaving my legs very smooth. I would buy a new one (since the replacement parts were expensive compared to the price of a new shaver, and the battery wasn't holding a charge, and there didn't seem to be many options) and repeat the frustration. No more. I found the solution in my husband's drawer - buy a men's shaver. I purchased the Panasonic ES-LT41-K (the same one my hubby has used happily for over a year), and after using it several months, will never buy another pink shaver targeted at women again.<br /><br />Hands down, the men's shaver is better. Although more expensive (yet still reasonably priced, imo) than the women's shaver, the ES-LT41-K delivers much better value. I am still amazed that, unlike the ES2216PC, this thing can be used daily for well over a week before needing a charge. (And the recharge is blazing fast - no more leaving my shaver charging overnight to barely get one decent shave before the motor is slowing down.) It delivers a closer shave, and is quite comfortable to use.<br /><br />Ladies, save your money and just buy a men's shaver instead.

  522. I bought this razor back in June, and it was fine. However, after only 4 months (maybe using it twice a week), it is terrible. I run over and over the same area and no hair comes off. I've ordered a new Replacement Shaver Foil and Blade Set, so we'll see if that solves the problem. If it does and I have to replace it every 4 months, I'm going to be upset. Also, I found the set cheaper on 1800 parts dot com with free shipping.<br /><br />ETA: I've replaced the foils, which doesn't seem to have fixed the problem. There are also no instructions on the web that I can find on how to replace them - we had to take a tiny screw driver and pry out the old ones. The new ones seem to pull on my skin/hair. I think I might just try a men's razor. I'm sad this is the best reviewed women's electric razor. It seems like my old one that bit the dust was much better.
  523. I was rather disappointed with this electric shaver. I found that it does not shave as closely or as evenly as previous electric shavers I've used. I noticed that regardless of the angle I held the shaver at, the left side of the shaver would always work better than the right, making it so that I had to repeat the area multiple times. Also, the blades seem to go dull very quickly- afte about a month and a half of moderate use! After that time, the shaver kept pulling the hair instead of shaving it, leading to an unpleasant experience and numerous bumps and redspots. The one advantage to this shaver is the wet/dry function which is very useful for using in the shower. Overall, I would say that this is an okay shaver for the price, but if you can afford it, get a slightly more expensive and higher quality shaver that will shave evenly.
  524. My wife wondered how she ever got along without this. No more bloody ankles or knees. She is quite pleased and plans on getting our daughters their own.
  525. If your hair is fine and baby like, you have to go over and over the hair repeatedly to get it off. I guess I am going to stick to shaving with a razor which seems to work best. However, my sister tried it on her legs, and she liked it a lot so I gave it to her.
