Now that it has been a few months, I feel like it is time to review:<br /><br />The razor itself seems a bit &#34;cheap&#34;, since most of the parts are made of plastic, and it isn't quite as heavy as the Phillips Norelco Men's shaver which I have. Having mentioned this, the razor does function well as intended! It will cut (wet or dry), however, it will never compete with a straight razor, as this razor seems to leave a little &#34;stubble&#34;. In a pinch, it does the job, however. My wife has complained that it's tough to get the hair in the arm-pits and around the ankles.<br /><br />For the price, I believe it was worth it. You can take it through security at the airport (which has come in handy multiple times), and you don't have to jump in the shower in order to shave when you are running out of time. I docked one star due to the &#34;cheap&#34; construction.

  581. I have very sensitive skin and course leg hair, which makes it extremely difficult and painful for me to shave my legs on a regular basis. To top it off, I live in Las Vegas where it is sunny and nice 9 months out of the year. I have tried many different options including exfoliating creams, scrubs, waxing, and laser hair removal (my leg hair is too light for it to be effective)and decided that I would try an electric razor again, because the last time I tried them years ago they were not effective in hair removal.<br /><br />I did not have the highest hopes for this electric razor, but it was under $30 and couldn't hurt to try it. In the shower,I lather my legs with soap and use the electric razor two-three days after I shave with a razor. While it does not make my legs razor smooth, the hair is not as visible. Which, I consider a victory. The best part though and what I am really (really!!) happy with, it that with doing this I do not have any problems with red irritated skin and I am able to shave my legs with a razor every week if I want. Which is HUGE for me.<br /><br />I have just been sticking with my schedule of shaving every other week and using the electric razor for times in-between. My legs look better and I have been enjoying wearing dresses at least once a week for the first time in my life and I am in my late 20's!<br /><br />My results may not be acceptable for everyone, but if you too have course hair and sensitive skin (and I can't be the only one out there), it may work for you as well.<br /><br />5.23.11 ETA: While I enjoyed this product while it lasted, after less than 10-months it no longer turns on. It worked regularly two days ago. The battery died and I charged it last night and this morning, it would not turn on. Very disappointing. I will be looking for a different brand to replace this one.

Then again, you won't get rivulets of blood running down your legs, either (I'm 30 and I still haven't managed to learn to shave without major blood loss, so this thing is a blessing a medical miracle). You also have to get used to going over the same patch a few times, but you can be more leisurely since you can shave while watching TV (if single and live by oneself). Don't like the hideous color (reminds me of a marital aid), and I've no idea what the \\"bikini attachment\\" is supposed to do. Is it a comb? How does it \\"trim\\" hair to a longer length? I'm no slouch in natural science and it makes no sense to me, either theoretically or in practice. Haven't had the scratching problem other ladies have mentioned. It does work better dry than wet. I do wish it didn't just discard the removed hair like one of those lawnmowers without the bag attachment, though. Still, I think this is the best out there in its category.

I was warned electric razors don't get as close as a normal razor but I was actually really surprised how close this got for the first few times I shaved. I've had it for about a year now and am considering getting a different one. This razor really isn't too bad, but I understand what a lot of people are saying. It does spit hair out randomly all over your leg, it's not the nicest thing to see but I discovered if you pop up the pop up trimmer when you're done with each leg there's hair in it that you can take a tissue and clean out. The charger is kind of a pain. It would be nice to have a cord so I could shave when it's plugged in. There isn't any kind of indicator that shows battery so it's died in the middle of me shaving quite a few times. However I realized if you just listen to it then you can tell when it's running low because it starts slowing down. As for the noise I don't really care much. It doesn't bother me or the people I live with. I absolutely can not shave my underarms with this razor, I've tried numerous times and it burns and scratches. I haven't been able to figure out why it does this. It occasionally scratches my legs but the marks go away pretty quickly and it isn't that painful. All in all I think it's a pretty nice razor, I don't shave often but compared to what I was going through with my allergy, this is WAY better!
  629. I am not sure why manufacturers can't make a high end razor for women. Skip this and just by a better men's electric shaver.
  630. Love the shave and comfort of this razor. Convenient to use always ready and fully charged.
  631. It works but not as good as you would expect it to
  632. I don't think it's capable of giving a close shave. Very disappointed and should have returned it. I guess blades are the only option after, but was hoping that in the 20 yrs since I had used an electric razor someone had actually figured out how to get them to work.
  633. Arrived quickly. The reason I am giving it 3 stars is due to the fact that it is not very durable. After first use it fell(of course). Upon first fall it broke into three pieces, we had put it back together but it seems you can not use the back blade. After reading the other reviews I thought this would hold up to crazy wear and tear a little better.
  634. This razor is the best one I have ever used and it is worth is every penny. I have used different ones over the years and I don't have very difficult hair to cut but I have hair that sticks to my legs and this razor gets everyone of them.<br />I have used it under my arms and it gives a nice close shave there too. Pivoting head makes it easy on the curves. I just cant say enough positive things about this razor.

The trimming function also didn't work. Even after sitting on the charger for days before use- so I know it wasn't from lack of charge. Then today, I tried to give it another chance, and I accidentally dropped it 2 ft on to the ground. It broke into many pieces and the blades all came apart and the plastic snapped. Not fixable.   652. I purchased the Panasonic ES2216PC Close Curves Wet/Dry shaver because, well, I am lazy. I hate shaving my legs. In fact it has been quite a few months since I last shaved- I have coarse, think leg hair. Hey, I'm Italian it comes with the territory. You make awesome baked goods, and yah you have hairy legs. Right out of the package, I turned it on. Yes, the directions state you should charge for 24 hours before using. I couldn't wait any longer. I put it on the clipper setting and started shearing, uh, cutting. Then I used the shaving setting.<br /><br />After reading the reviews about how it doesn't provide a close shave, I agree. But we are talking millimeters, not inches. If I run my hand down my leg, I can feel something, but it isn't like a man's stubble, or even than noticeable. Another comparison is that I have jet black leg hair- you can't see the hair. Now, I am believing that your mileage may vary on how often you will need to shave to keep it unnoticeable, but that's going to depend on your genetics. The razor can't control that.<br /><br />The razor isn't magic. You aren't going to shave and then never have to shave again. It does cut the hair pretty darn close to the skin.<br /><br />The razor shape was comfortable in my hand. The razor head moves left to right, up and down, in addition to forward and backwards. For me, this feature made it virtually impossible for me to nick my skin. Did I mention I have sensitive skin? Well, so far no irritation. I can't speak of ingrown hairs because it has only been a few hours.<br /><br />I shaved dry, haven't used the wet dry functionality. However the directions do state that &#34; you will notice a difference after a few weeks of wet shaving.&#34; Not sure exactly what they mean about that, but I might as well try it.
  653. This is a great razor for women. It shaves closely without biting the sensitive areas and can be used wet or dry.
  654. My wife loves this product. It does everything she wants, she loves the wet/dry functionality, and the battery lasts for a long time. This is a great purchase.

I would always be scratching my underarms as the hair grew back. I always had to use a disposable razor after using the electric razor, which was time consuming.<br /><br />So, I decided to finally shop for a new one, but I didn't want to spend a ton of money on it. I am extremely thorough in my quest for a new product--from cleaning products to shavers. I always do a ton of research and read lots and lots of product reviews. I was surprised to find this one at such a reasonable price for an electric shaver. I am amazed at the price becasuse the product works like a dream! Typically, you would only find such a great and close shave in the more expensive products. But, this shaver gave me the closest shave I've ever had with an electric shaver. It was just as good as using a disposable razor and did not cause any itchy re-growth. I am extremely pleased with this shaver and look forward to using it over and over again. I use it on the bikini and underarm area with amazing results. I definitely recommend buying this if you are in the market for a new shaver.

  740. I was very happy with this razor for about two months. Although it does not give as close of a shave as my good old Venus and shower gel did, I liked that I could use it dry (saved time as I could shave while reading!) and thought that I would end up saving money by not having to buy those expensive Venus cartridges. However, after about two months, I noticed it was shaving less and less efficiently - I would have to go over the same part of my leg literally 5 or 6 times to get a decent shave (both wet and dry)! At this point, it was taking a good ten minutes just to shave about a couple of square inches of skin, so I cast it aside and returned to Venus. It seems like the blades get dull VERY quickly, even though the information included with the razor claimed the blades would last at least a year or more before needing to be replaced. I don't think the dulling was an issue with my use or care of the razor, as I didn't use it very often to begin with (not more than three times a week at MOST) and I always cleaned it and stored it in a dry place after using it, so I don't think rusting was an issue. After all of this I was still too lazy to come on here and write a negative review until today (~6 months after I purchased the razor) - I got it out, charged it, and now the thing doesn't even turn on, period, even when plugged into the wall! Currently struggling with Amazon to get a refund on this. Do NOT waste your money or time!
  741. If you have course hair, this shaver will probably not benefit you. You have to put pressure in order to get somewhat of a close shave.
  742. the wife loved her Christmas present.
  743. I purchased this in November of 2011. Granted that's awhile ago. My main problem is, once the battery stops charging, you can't replace the battery. I took it apart to see if there was a rechargeable battery inside. If you plan to do the same, don't bother. I thought it should last at least a year AND have replaceable batteries. Now it just has to go to the landfill. I gave it 2 stars only because it did work well for a shaver. Not as close as a blade razor but good enough if you're not picky about being picky

  754. I purchased this because the razor blades I use are so expensive and I literally have to use 2 of them to completely do my legs ankle to groin. Plus, no matter how careful I am, I ALWAYS get razor burn because I have such sensitve skin. So I thought this would be a perfect solution. First of all, I wasn't expecting a really close shave, but I ended up having to go over my legs again with a regular razor and honestly, the regular razor irritated me LESS than this, even wet with shave lotion on. This just does not get all the hairs no matter how many times you go over the same spot, and sorry but it irritated my sensitve skin even when wet, and more so dry. I probably will continue to use it on my inner thighs just because I have a hard time using a regular razor without cutting myself in that area. And it would be OK for a quick \\"I forgot to shave and I need to go out\\" shave. But I won't be using it much. And it does work on your face, but honestly, my husbands 3 headed electric razor works better for my face and does not irritate me. When the blades on this get dull, I'll be throwing it away instead of buying more blades (which by the way cost as much as the shaver).
  755. I was previously using a 20 year old electric shaver which started acting up a bit so I decided to get a new one. This new one is worse! It gives a much worse shave. I have had it for a few months now and it just gives a horrible shave. I have to go over and over and over the same area and it doesn't look much better in the end. I think the issue is that there is no cord. So after a charge, it works well for about 2 minutes, but then as it looses power it stops shaving closely. I'm not sure what is so bad about a cord that manufacturers no longer include the option? Corded items like this always work better than cordless, but I couldn't even find a corded razor so had to go with this one. I am sure this item will not last 20 years like my old one, as it already doesn't hold a charge well enough to shave very close.

  792. I bought this Panasonic shaver to replace an old Remington shaver that was probably due for retirement long ago. As I could not find another Remington model that seemed to suit me, I decided to try the Panasonic. The pivoting head feature is a great idea, as it makes shaving much more forgivable and seems to reduce irritation. I have not experienced any irritation so far and find that shaving with this is rather quick and pain-free. As other reviewers have noted, this will not give as close a shave as with a razor, but any man who's used the two different methods of shaving will tell you the same. For the closest shave, you would need to use a razor rather an electric shaver. But overall, I find the Panasonic shaver does a very good job providing a fairly close shave. The pivoting head and multiple blades seem to have been nicely designed with a woman's needs in mind. I also like the charger that does not require any cords, but plugs right into the outlet. Considering what the price is for some higher-end drugstore disposable razors, I would say this is a very good buy and will certainly last much longer than a multi-pack of Ladies Gillette's.
  793. Have used this shaver dry for 3 weeks and enjoy its close and comfortable shave. Handles well, shaves close, and is easy to clean.
  794. I purchased this shaver in July of 2011. By the end of August, the pop-up trimmer switch had jammed. I called the warranty number for Panasonic. After the \\"automated assistant\\" was unable to understand what I needed, I was referred to a human who also had trouble understanding what I needed. She told me I would need to ship my entire razor to either New York or California to have it fixed. I asked if I would have to pay shipping; she did not answer. She gave me a telephone number to call which was not toll free. I asked for and received a toll-free number, but when I called it I was referred to the non-toll free number. The razor cost less than $30; it's not worth paid calls and shipping costs and who knows how long a wait to get it fixed. I'll just buy a different razor to replace it, and it won't be a Panasonic!
  795. good enough for shaving legs, under arms and face.Doesn't leave legs very smooth but I have coarse hair on my legs. Works great on under arms. Beth
  796. I chose this shaver after reading reviews of several electric shavers online, and this one had the most positive reviews. It does not shave as close as a regular razor, but that's a given with electric shavers. With that being said, I still get a fairly close shave. The bikini attachment is one of the other reasons I chose this shaver, and it works great. One of the reviews mentioned getting scratched from the plastic casing around the top of the razor. The instructions state to hold the shaver at a 90 degree angle against the skin. Holding the shaver at less of an angle puts your skin in contact with the trimmer, which can scratch you if you're not paying attention. Sometimes I may scratch myself slightly around the ankle bone (not majorly) if I'm not holding the shaver 90 degrees against my skin. It hasn't been much of an issue for me. I'm very happy with this shaver.
  797. Have had this razor for several weeks and really like it. Close shave, thanks in part to the flexible head. Would buy again.

I would have to spend at least a half hour a day after my shower pressing tissue paper up against the nicks that my razor left me with. Oh and forget the days where I used a brand new razor!! I would be there for an hour!<br /><br />I wasn't going to rush into making as purchase, I wanted to do my research first. After reading countless reviews on Amazon and elsewhere, I concluded that the Panasonic ES2216PC wet/dry shaver was the bugatti of women's electric shavers! And boy was I right! This shaver has definitely lived up to it's expectations!<br /><br />I love the wet/dry function. The fact that I can do a quick touch-up dry shave anytime I want is invaluable. Shaving is now convenient and easy. The shaver head is much more mobile than I had imagined it would be. The head pivots back and forth and the individual blades have something called a \\"floating system\\" which allow them to move independently of one another. And when you're all done, the shaver rests on a convenient charging system which plugs right into the wall, vertically or horizontally.<br /><br />Oh yeah, and the fact that it is impossible to cut yourself on one of these babys is the icing on the cake! Highly recommended!

I'd gotten really tired of buying and then throwing away those little tiny trimmers, since you can't ever find replacement blades for then. Plus, refills for this product were easy to come by.<br /><br />At first, I was very happy with it. It shaved both legs and bikini areas without any problems, and was very easy to clean. Be aware that it doesn't get rid of all the stubble- I used it to cut longer hairs, then I'd go back with a regular razor to get it completely smooth. As I had only intended to use the product occasionally and as a supplement to my regular razor, that was fine by me.<br /><br />After six months of use, however, I'm very unsatisfied with it. I just replaced the blades for the first time, thinking I'd get the same performance as brand new, but that was not the case. What they don't tell you on the packaging or in the manual is that the foils and the cutter blades are replaceable, but the trimmer blades are not. This means that when you go to shave longer hairs, the trimmer yanks on them really painfully, and doesn't cut them at all. Ouch! I have over forty dollars invested in this product, and now it's essentially useless. I wish I could get my money back.

  839. After reviewing a few different makes and models of electric razors, I chose this one because it claimed super sharp blades and a very close shave. I am NOT disappointed. Even if I have to go back and forth once or twice to get a good close shave (I understand that is normal for electric razors?), I do not suffer razor rash at all. Underarms are as smooth with this razor as with a traditional 3-blade throw-away razor, and this one has a pivoting head that glides across my skin much easier than any traditional razor I've used. The bikini attachment is very useful and the entire head assembly is easy to use, easy to disassemble for cleaning, and easy to clean.<br /><br />If you are considering an electric razor, I can't recommend this enough. I've only used it a few times but I have had zero problems with the razor itself or the shaving. No pulled hairs, no rash or bumps, and no nicks. Instructions say it'll take a couple weeks of steady shaving to get the &#34;best result&#34;, but I am already happy with its performance. The &#34;WET/DRY&#34; claim is also true; I've used it in and out of the shower, even dropped it once onto a tile floor and it did not break. Durable and amazing. 5 stars!

  885. I was upgraded to this model a few years ago, after my old Panasonic shaver died and the company proved unable to repair it. The razor works okay, as far as electric shavers go. Naturally, the shave isn't anywhere near as close as with a disposable razor, but that's to be expected. As with other electric razors I've tried, I usually have to go over an area several times to get all the hairs, and every time I've used it on my underarms, I've ended up with razor burn. I've never used it in the shower, but in dry conditions it's somewhat comfortable and easy to operate and maintain. Not the best shaver I've ever tried - that distinction goes to my husband's Norelco 5603x, much to his chagrin - but not the worst, either. In terms of function, I give it a 3/5.<br /><br />That said, somewhere between this and my old model, Pansonic decided to replace the cord charger with a wall-mounted unit. Perhaps they thought this a sleeker design that takes up less counter space? However, the wall unit makes it difficult to charge the razor in tight spaces. For example, the outlet over my bathroom counter sits right under a windowsill; the lack of vertical space renders it useless for charging the Panasonic 2216. Worse still, over time the charger has ceased working altogether. Because the razor is top-heavy and curves slightly outward, it pulls forward, away from the wall - and off the base of the charger. With normal use, the connection between the razor and charger has loosened to the point that I can no longer force the razor to stand upright on its base. Charging became intermittent and then stopped altogether. I haven't been able to charge it in months. I hate to get rid of it, since it isn't broken or anything - but unless Panasonic releases a replacement cord charger, it's as good as useless.

  889. For the first few months of use this electric shaver worked fine. It needed a few passes to really trim the hair on my legs, but I have found that to be the case with all electric shavers I have used.<br /><br />However, after a couple months it began to not cut very cleanly, and then began to snag and pull out hairs painfully. I treated the shaver gently, stored it in a dry place and cleaned it carefully once a month. I don't know if the product just gives out after a short period, if I got a lemon or if there was some user-error on my part, but I am displeased with my purchase and I wouldn't buy this model again.<br /><br />Another point of note about the product is that the charger plugs directly into the wall, so keep that in mind. I couldn't plug it in the outlet in my bathroom because the outlet is immediately below my medicine cabinet. It was nice to have it up and out of the way for charging in the outlet that I did plug it into, though.

  891. Over the years, I've tried maybe a dozen different electric razors and epilators, and this is the only one I've purchased twice. I use a normal razor for my legs (it's a closer shave and isn't irritating to the less sensitive skin), but I find that an electric razor works best for my underarms and bikini area. Most electric razors still pinch in those areas, but this one doesn't as long as I keep the skin flat while working. It still gets closer than I can manage with a normal razor, but doesn't cause irritation even when shaving against the grain. I had the last one for several years (of in-shower use) before the motor started to get a bit weaker and the blades a bit dull, and I think an average of $7-10 a year for a shave this good is extremely reasonable, so I bought another one - no questions asked. When this one starts to go south, I plan to do the same thing again.

  942. This is a great shaver! I saw a lot of complaints about this not shaving very close... duh! It's a freakin' electric shaver, its not a razor! I'll be honest... I bought this because after a surgery on my back, I was left with very little feeling in the back of my thighs. I had been a shaving with a common Gillete razor before this incident and after many cuts, I decided I needed to switch. Think about it, we shave the back of our upper legs by feel, I couldn't feel it, so things got dangerous, haha!<br /><br />I researched a lot of shavers before deciding on this one. I'm glad I did! It works like a charm and gives me a pretty close shave, despite it being an electric shaver. My advice to you though... don't do what I did. I used it in the shower and out and would always rinse out the pieces when I was done, then put it back on the charger. Over time, it stopped working very well, until it stopped doing anything... not the motor, but the internal blades. They wouldn't cut one single hair and it's not like I have crazy hair growth or anything. My Husband is a knife collector/user and will sit an sharpen his knives while we watch movies and stuff, so I asked him about it. He asked me if the shaver came with oil to treat it the blades. No, it doesn't. He was like, if you get metal wet and then let it air dry, it will dull the edge of the blade. That makes sense. So, I bought the blade replacement set for it and he let's me use his gun oil on the blade when I'm done and it's been amazing ever since... who would have known! It doesn't say anything about oiling the blades in the instruction manual... guess they want to make that money on the replacement blades.<br /><br />So, after you use it... rinse the blades off, like take the part off and rinse it out... dry it with a towel real quick, then put it back together. Put a dot of oil on each of the outer foils and on the two clippers on each end, then turn it on and run it for like 3 seconds. That's it. I promise you, your shaver will now last way longer... thank sweet baby Jesus for guys that know about knives and stuff.. I promise you, your shaver will now last way longer... thank sweet baby Jesus for guys that know about knives and stuff.

If I squeezed the head it would work a little but something just wasn't catching properly on the inside. I figured it still worked OK so I just turned it around and used the back trimmer for longer hairs. Slowly though, the back trimmer has stopped working as well. I took it traveling with me and one of the delicate plastic parts on the top of the plug that the handle snaps onto got bent and snapped off. So now it doesn't plug in right unless I balance it just so... I know that some of that is basic wear and tear but it was a delicate design that is easily damaged if you put it in your suitcase. I've also found that since it's heavy it just slides out of some outlets completely. I've had to tape it to the wall to keep it charging before. I've only had it about a year and sometimes it won't even turn on and it's noticeably slower. I still use it on my knees and armpits because the Remington I bought to replace (wet/dry with the aloe vera strip) cuts me pretty badly in those areas but does an OK job on flat parts of my legs. I have uneven skin under my arms, and have deep pockets, making traditional blade-razors very difficult to use. This razor glides over the skin without any pinching, burning or biting. I have been using it every 1-2 days for over a month now. I am thrilled with it. I plan on buying a 2nd one for my 13-year old daughter so she will leave mine alone!<br /><br />I do not shave the bikini area with it, so I cannot make any recommendations on that!
  955. This is terrible. I used to use an old men's Norelco on my legs years ago, and it worked fairly well. This is useless. The bikini attachment is a joke, you can't use the thing on your armpits without harming the sensitive skin, and yeah, it gets a fairly decent shave on your legs, but only after spending too much time going the same area over and over again...<br /><br />My story began as an effort to leave behind over priced cartridge razors that keep adding blades and other nonsense. I wanted to stop paying for products that irritated my sensitive skin. This didn't really do that since it only worked on my legs... Barely.<br /><br />I am making the leap to a safety razor. This terrible razor has left me looking for better things. I am purchasing a Merker safety razor after this review, and, fingers crossed, I won't be looking back.
  956. After 1 year this razor simply doesn't cut my fine hair anymore. I can go over my legs multiple times to no avail. I've tried it wet and dry. Won't buy another one!
  957. I bought this to use because I am on blood thinners. I am really used to manual razors, but this one does well in the shower. Great that you can get it wet and not have to worry about it. Would really like a little closer shave, but all in all it does well.
  958. I've used it both wet and dry, either way it gave a good close shave. If you use wet be sure to have something on the skin besides just water. I use hair conditioner, you just need a little something to act as a lube to glide easy over skin.

  978. It's only thirty bucks and it shaves my legs in less than five minutes, close and smooth, completely dry. I can put on a skirt, think, 'hmm, should probably shave' and do it and be out the door in less time than it usually takes me to find my car keys!<br /><br />It's not as close or as smooth a shave as wet shaving but with this thing the convenience is the key factor. It's SO darned quick I can't believe I didn't get one of these in my teens, when I started needing to shave my legs.<br /><br />Another reviewer said that this is excellent as a dry shaver OR a wet shaver but not very good if you try to shave damp skin (say, after a shower). That's absolutely right. Pick either wet or dry and be impressed, but don't try 'damp' shaving, it doesn't do as well.

It doesn't get as close as a razor but it is faster so I use it for touch ups...you just don't get the smooth feeling.

  1053. First of all I have to say...if you CAN use a regular blade razor with shaving cream, soap, or what have you, DO IT! An electric razor will *NEVER* shave as close as a regular blade razor (nope, no totally silky soft skin), nor will you shave as quickly, so stop looking at electric razors to save time...because you won't.<br /><br />What I wouldn't give to be able to use a blade razor. Unfortunately, my skin is ultra-sensitive and every time I try to shave my legs with a blade razor they itch so much after about 30 minutes that only drawing blood will get me to stop scratching my legs (no matter what moisturizer I use), and I don't even want to think about the ingrown hairs that develop after a couple of days. I've tried everything for \\"after-shave\\" to help...from Tend Skin to exfoliation...and nothing works for me. So, I'm stuck using electric razors.<br /><br />If there's a better electric razor out there for women, I have not found it. I've tried at least ten different ones and this is, by FAR, the best that I've tried. It's the closest shave I've found in an electric, doesn't pull at all unless I'm going WAY too fast, has never nicked me once, and really hugs my legs because of the pivoting head. I've had my Panasonic razor for probably three years, and the rechargeable battery is still kicking. I still get at least 30 minutes out of it on a charge. It was at least 45 when I first got it! OK, so I have to go over some spots twice to get all of the hair...oh well! I can definitely live with that, and I've had the same problem with every other electric I've used. To me, this is the best women's electric shaver out there.

  1057. This razor is WONDERFUL and stands up to every expectation that I had!! In 2010 I had open heart surgery to replace the aortic valve in my heart and since then I have been on blood thinners and not recommended to use regular razors. I have searched and tried many different ones but they didn't do what I wanted. The last razor I had, the foil over the blades literally tore through and that is what led me to buying this razor. I wanted one that matched my needs and this one sure did!!! It gives a super close shave on my legs, underarms and bikini area. I was skeptical at first until I was actually able to try it and I won't buy any other one after having this one. You can also order parts for it should it fail in an area like needing blades or foil head and other parts. The razor I had before you couldn't use it underarms or \\"other\\" area...only legs, and when the foil broke, there was no way to buy the replacement parts so I hunted and found this razor and I'm so very glad that I did. It is worth every bit of the money paid for it!! Funny thing is, this one is actually cheaper than the one I had before and this one does 10x better job than the one I had before! Thank you Panasonic for this wonderful product and I hope this review helps others see what a wonderful product this is.
  1058. I purchased this in July 2012 and at first it worked ok and I ended up throwing it away last week. It has poor quality and maybe I should have invested more money in a shaver or tried another brand. I won't buy this again... I'll try another brand and spend a bit more than the $30 I spent on it.

  1060. I have only used it once but so far i'm very pleased. I have pretty coarse hair and I was still able to get a really close shave. I hate getting ingrown hairs from razors so that's what made me try this and I don't think i'll be getting anymore with this shaver.

  1064. I got this shaver to replace my older Remington, but returned it after only one use. Compared to the Remington, it is very underpowered and does not give a close shave on my legs. This isn't my first time using an electric shaver, I switched over from blades two years ago, and the hair wasn't even very long. My legs still felt scratchy after many passes of the shaver. The pivoting head is not in any way useful, didn't seem to make any positive difference. Also, as one other reviewer noted, the plastic bits next to the foils are thin and scratched my legs with each pass. The Remington has thicker plastic there and never scratched me.<br /><br />The only thing I liked about this shaver was how well it did on my underarms. Because is isn't as powerful as the Remington, it is gentler on more sensitive skin and didn't catch. However, I already have another smaller shaver for this and didn't need a replacement, especially if it should be able to do my legs as well.

  1067. I had been looking for a new electric razor and not having any success in stores (all they had were the kind that yanks the hair out).   1068. I have very sensitive skin and this razor was magic! Well, for about a week. Then the thing would cut off randomly while I was using it, even when fully charged. After a while it just wouldn't turn on. I was extremely upset because it was a Christmas gift from my parents and I thought I had broken it. We returned it with full refund and bought another. Same thing happened; returned it for a full refund and bought another.<br /><br />This time, the package had been discarded, so we couldn't return it after it began the tantrum. We took it apart and my dad found that the connectors were slipping, so he put them back. Everything was absolutely perfect for several months! Then one day it cut out again, and came back just long enough for me to finish some armpit shearing. Afterwards it never came back on. My dad took it apart, and this time it was something else in addition to the connectors, and in trying to fix it a tiny, some 4 millimeter plastic piece snapped off. Apparently it was an important piece that renders the entire razor absolutely useless if gone.<br /><br />I will not buy another Panasonic. I loved it when it worked, but it was so much of a hassle (buying three razors in a row with the same exact problem, sheesh!) that I'm going to try my luck somewhere else.

Before if I wanted to wear shorts without little red irritation spots I had to do a rain dance, pray, massage my legs with peacock feathers, and hope that my skin was having a happy day. I am STOKED to use this in the summer because though it does not give you as close of a shave as a normal razor it keeps your legs visibly smooth with zero irritation, which is all you need most of the time for wearing shorts and stuff. If I am wearing a bikini I would definitely use my regular razor to get a super close shave though. But overall this is making my skin SO much happier.hough. But overall this is making my skin SO much happier.
  1122. I don't have much experience with electric shavers so when I decided to buy one to escape the irritating razor burn I was getting, I poured over all the lady shaver reviews. I came out more confused and unsure than when I went in. But I purchased this because it was the only one who had almost all the features I wanted. Rechargable battery, a bikini trim pop up blade, wet/dry, and a &#34;grooming attachment&#34;. The only thing it was missing was a cord in case the battery was dead, and I wanted to shave immediately. However, the shaver companies think we are too stupid to figure out you can't bring a cord into the shower and. if we live through the electrocution, they'll get sued, so no cord. I'll reserve my thoughts on how many people WOULD actually do that and on the sad state of society, and get on with the review.<br /><br />Anyway, I have found that the battery life is pretty good. Make sure you charge the shaver for a FULL 24 HOURS before first use. I think that's important to get a full charge on the battery. I take my time shaving and so far I got four shaves and still didn't need a recharge but I set it on the charger anyway. It has a small charger that plugs into to the wall outlet, with a post on top that fits in the bottom of the charger. The razor is upright, against the wall as it charges. See the picture attached to my review. You can get a regular sized plug in under the charger but anything bulkier probably isn't going to work. Obviously if you were to put the charger in the bottom outlet, you're going to cover the whole thing up.<br /><br />Now, as for the operation of the shaver. I would say I have medium thickness and density hair. I am not a bear, and I'm not baby fine. It takes a little longer than you'd think, with more passes, to use an electric shaver over a hand held manual razor. I takes about three passes to get all the hair. I use it dry so far, I have yet to use it wet. However, it has a pretty wide swath, you can go back and forth along your leg pretty fast, and you don't have to pay that much attention, so it goes quickly. I did not get scraped up, I didn't get any irritation, and I have VERY sensitive skin that reddens very easily. I am satisfied with the closeness and shaving action on my legs.<br /><br />Now for the bikini trimmer. This pops up with a slide button on the razor. It is a bit on the dull side. Don't be afraid to touch it on your skin pretty hard. If you hover all timid-like, your hair gets yanked, or your skin does. I didn't bleed but it hurt. It doesn't get all the hair in the area. It missed a lot. I found the bikini line shaver thing is not all that great, but I have another trimmer for that :) It does a good enough job for a quick touch up for this old, married chick. Other ladies with date nights, maybe not so much.<br /><br />All In all, I am happy enough with the purchase. I felt that. compared to the other same-priced razors. I made the right choice. I don't love the razor, but I like it well enough that I will keep it until it dies and try another brand.ng your leg pretty fast, and you don't have to pay that much attention, so it goes quickly. I did not get scraped up, I didn't get any irritation, and I have VERY sensitive skin that reddens very easily. I am satisfied with the closeness and shaving action on my legs.<br /><br />Now for the bikini trimmer. This pops up with a slide button on the razor. It is a bit on the dull side. Don't be afraid to touch it on your skin pretty hard. If you hover all timid-like, your hair gets yanked, or your skin does. I didn't bleed but it hurt. It doesn't get all the hair in the area. It missed a lot. I found the bikini line shaver thing is not all that great, but I have another trimmer for that :) It does a good enough job for a quick touch up for this old, married chick. Other ladies with date nights, maybe not so much.<br /><br />All In all, I am happy enough with the purchase. I felt that. compared to the other same-priced razors. I made the right choice. I don't love the razor, but I like it well enough that I will keep it until it dies and try another brand.

Second, in order to get a fix/replacement, they want me to pay to mail this thing back to them. They refuse to help me otherwise. For something like this, that's ridiculous because it's not worth the postage. I might as well buy a new one and toss this thing in the trash, where it belongs. Any company that forces you to spend more money (on a low cost item such as this) to send their crap back to them before they'll fix/replace it isn't standing by their product, isn't providing good customer service and isn't worth my time and money, nor yours. I'd not even give them 1 star if that was an option. Also...the automated system for Panasonic made me repeat the model number 4 times and gave me the run around worse than any human being ever could before it would put me through to a person.<br /><br />Edit:Thanks to Amazon I'm not getting ripped off after all. Thank you Amazon for taking care of this even though Panasonic wouldn't. Appreciate all your help.
  1155. The adapter stopped working within a year and Panasonic refused to stand by their two year warranty to replace it. They wanted $35 for a new adapter, the same price as this stupid thing new. Not worth the cost when it broke so easily and they refused to fix it.
  1156. Worked well for two years then fell apart despite good care. The blade came off on one side and it could no longer be used safely. We will not purchase another one and will stay away from this brand unless we get a constructive response from the manufacturer. We intend to call the manufacturer and will give and update with their response.
  1157. I've had this for a while now and I just figured out how to get the best shave. I was going up and down my legs in long lines (like a straight razor but going down too) and it was doing a poor job, even shaving twice. Recently I figured out if you make short up and down strokes and go around and around the leg in a spiral, the shave is much closer and there are few missed hairs. Made a HUGE difference.<br /><br />Pro: Very long lasting battery. I can shave three or four times with this before it gets low and it holds its power between uses.<br /><br />Cons: Difficult to charge if you have sideways outlets in your house. It rests vertically on top of a small square box that plugs directly into the wall. This won't work in my bathroom as the outlets are horizontal so I have to charge elsewhere.
  1158. it works perfect. U can use it anytime anywhere....
  1159. I really like this razor.

  1165. I've been using electric razors for years now and had quite a few. There are not that many good electric razors out there for women but this is one of them! It's really quiet (for a ladies electric razor, my husbands norelco is virtually silent and this is not but is really quiet compared to my Remington), and it has a close shave and with the pivot head it contours all the angles on my legs. I've had a lot of Remington's but have had some trouble with the last ones (battery not lasting, needing to replace the blades more often etc) so I decided to go with this Panasonic and I love it! The charging base is weird but not a problem. If you have a Remington and are looking for a better replacement this s it!

  1182. Over years, it's been impossible finding a decent women's shaver. I had been using my husband's old brutal \\"on its last legs\\" shaver, but that machine chewed up my underarms on the lightest setting, even when pressing ever so slightly (almost not at all), to the degree that for 24 hours afterwards my underarms burned where it was agony to move my upper torso. So when that \\"malevolent\\" shaver died (good riddance), I tooled around Amazon looking for a replacement that had two characteristics: (1) designed for women; and (2) \\"benevolent.\\" I narrowed it down to this unit, and figured I'd try it. The price was reasonable.<br /><br />Let me qualify: I have fair hair and fair skin. I do NOT need a shaver designed for someone with dark, thick hair. I need a light-duty shaver, one that does the job delicately on underarms and legs. I certainly don't need anything resembling a depilatory/epilator--I am aghast that women knowingly seek out any such machine that pulls hair out by the roots, which is inhumane and torture. I am pleased with this Panasonic shaver not only because it works well, but because it is gentle. I call it a \\"lovingkindness\\" shaver--exactly what I was looking for. [Why did I wait so long?]<br /><br />I love it. I give it five (*****) and recommend it.<br /><br />-----------------<br />3 March 2013<br /><br />I still love it.

  1279. Love my Panasonic shaver. My other shavers were electric so I had to be close to an outlet in order to use. This one has a re-chargeable battery so it can be used anywhere. The charge also last a long time. I have not used it in the shower so I can not commit about how it performs wet.
  1280. I like that its cordless. Does a good job. Haven't tried wet shave yet, but dry shave works fine for me.
  1281. I hadn't bought a new shaver in quite some time and am very pleased with this product. I bought it last year and it has performed well throughout. Great value for the cost.
  1282. Love the shaver. Not sure what the bikini attachment is useful for since it barely works and always jams with the slighted amount of hair.
  1283. I'm very happy with this razor! For years I've been doing the old fashioned razor and shaving cream routine in the shower. The day my panasonic razor came in the mail, that all changed. There are so many positive points of this product.<br />1. The amount of time I save from not having to do the old routine is amazing. (Because it is quick to use and can be used dry).<br />2. The amount of energy I've saved (water energy from not having to be in the shower, and my own energy by not having to lather up).<br />3. It has eliminated the unsightly and painful razor bumps I used to get all over my legs, and leaves my skin so smooth. (My boyfriend loves my smooth legs, and I can let him touch them now without recoiling away in pain).<br />I've used this every single day since I've received it, and it has not disappointed me yet!
